nodes.label: Modern Art
nodes.description: An art movement characterized by a departure from traditional styles, emphasizing innovation and exploration of new techniques and concepts.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Modern art emerged in the late 19th century and spanned various styles and movements focused on experimentation.

nodes.label: Impressionism
nodes.description: An art movement focused on capturing light and natural forms through loose brushwork and vibrant colors.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Pioneered by artists like Claude Monet and Edgar Degas, it marked a shift from realistic depictions to personal impressions.

nodes.label: Cubism
nodes.description: An avant-garde movement that fragmented objects into geometric shapes, representing multiple perspectives simultaneously.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Developed by Pablo Picasso and Georges Braque, Cubism revolutionized visual representation.

nodes.label: Surrealism
nodes.description: An artistic movement aimed at unlocking the subconscious mind through dreamlike and irrational imagery.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Artists like Salvador Dalí and René Magritte explored the unconscious through imaginative works.

nodes.label: Abstract Expressionism
nodes.description: A post-World War II movement emphasizing spontaneous, abstract forms and emotional intensity.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Prominent figures include Jackson Pollock and Mark Rothko, whose works conveyed profound emotional depth.

nodes.label: Pop Art
nodes.description: A movement that challenged fine art traditions by incorporating imagery from popular culture and mass media.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Andy Warhol and Roy Lichtenstein celebrated consumerism and everyday objects in their art.

nodes.label: Modern Art Legacy
nodes.description: The enduring influence of modern art on contemporary practices and cultural perspectives.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Modern art laid the foundation for postmodernism and continues to inspire innovation.

nodes.label: Claude Monet
nodes.description: A leading figure in Impressionism, known for his series paintings of water lilies and landscapes.
nodes.generalKnowledge: His work, 'Impression, Sunrise,' gave the Impressionist movement its name.

nodes.label: Pablo Picasso
nodes.description: A Spanish artist who co-founded Cubism and revolutionized modern art.
nodes.generalKnowledge: His works include 'Les Demoiselles d'Avignon' and 'Guernica.'

nodes.label: Salvador Dalí
nodes.description: A surrealist artist renowned for his dreamlike and eccentric imagery.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Known for works like 'The Persistence of Memory.'

nodes.label: Jackson Pollock
nodes.description: An influential figure in Abstract Expressionism, famous for his drip painting technique.
nodes.generalKnowledge: His technique emphasized movement and spontaneity.

nodes.label: Andy Warhol
nodes.description: A leading figure in Pop Art, known for his works featuring consumer products and celebrities.
nodes.generalKnowledge: His iconic works include 'Campbell's Soup Cans' and portraits of Marilyn Monroe.

nodes.label: Postmodern Art
nodes.description: A movement that critiques and builds upon modern art through deconstruction and eclecticism.
nodes.generalKnowledge: Postmodern art challenges notions of originality and embraces multiple perspectives.
